title: Corktown Toronto street sign
author: open bracket

comments.content:
Fedra Sans Display Pro Heavy is close, but not quite:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans-display-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans-display-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans-display-pro/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FedraSans_4201.png)

Better match is Verdana Bold, though I think on your sample it's been compressed vertically, and maybe a stroke added to beef it up:

[http://www.fonts.com/font/microsoft-corporation/verdana/complete-family-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543/http:/www.fonts.com/font/microsoft-corporation/verdana/complete-family-pack "http://www.fonts.com/font/microsoft-corporation/verdana/complete-family-pack")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VerdanaBold_3667.png)

Verdana is a good call as long as her twin-sister [Tohama](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/tahoma). New to me now, while looking for a link to Tahoma on MyFonts, found [Mammoth](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/ft-mammoth) which interesting here, a bit bold though.

As for Verdana and Tahoma, both are Matthew Carter designs. Tahoma's letters are narrower and it has tighter letter spacing. There is a still narrower version called Nina.  
Verdana Pro from Ascender has a Black weight in addition to the Bold. Compare:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VerdanaProBoldInUse_5302.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VerdanaProBlackInUse_3879.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/verdana-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317175543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/verdana-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/verdana-pro/")  
If I was attempting to duplicate the \_CORKTOWN\_ sign I would create an intermediate weight of these two fonts.  
--------  
UPDATE:  
However, IIRC, when white letters are placed on a dark background they appear thinner than when dark letters are placed on a dark background. It's worth converting Verdana Black to a white on dark version and comparing it to the \_CORKTOWN\_ sign.  
Don
Don you UPDATE makes a very interesting point in judging size etc.

Thank you so much for the keen eyes and advice everyone. Very much appreciated!

kthomps5: I think you're correct about the image sample being compressed slightly.

donshottype: Very good advice. I think I will create an intermediate, but will compare with different colours first.

Thanks again all.
